src: ARI : Hello . My name is ARI . Can I help you ? # greet ( ) ; inform ( ari ( name ) ) ; offer-help ( ) RC : Yes , I do . I have to go and see someone who 's hospitalised and I ca n't remember the ward . It 's room 17 . Can you please tell me where it is ? # request ( location ( room_17 ) ) [start] ARI : You continue along the building , take the lift , and it 's on the second floor . [MASK] RC : Ok , thank you . [MASK] ARI : Thank you . [MASK] LP : Look , I have an appointment , but um , for my friend who is here . I ca n't remember the appointment time . Could you tell me ? [MASK] ARI : Sorry , I do n't have this information . You have to go to the reception . [MASK] LP : Ok , thank you . Where is the reception ? [MASK] ARI : You have to enter the second building behind you . Then it 's the second door on the left . [MASK] LP : Ok , thank you . [MASK] RC : I have an appointment at 5 o'clock in the cardiology department . I do n't know where that is . Could you tell me please ? [MASK] ARI : Sorry , I do n't have this information . I 'll call a nurse to come and help you . [MASK] [end] ARI : Thank you . See you soon . Have a nice day . # thank ( ) ; bye ( ) RC : Thank you , bye . # thank ( ) ; bye ( ) LP : See you soon . You too , have a nice day . # bye ( )

src: LP : Well it 's my first time here , I do n't know if this is the case for you . I 'd really like to um ... to be able , to be able to eat a little bit before going to my appointment , do you know where that is ? # request ( food ) RC : You have a good idea ... LP : So um , is it ... # incomplete-da ( ) RC : But I do n't know where we eat , so what do I do ? What do I do ? # request ( help ) LP : So , can we eat ? Is there a designated area for visitors ? # request ( food ) RC : Before lunch , I 'd like to have breakfast . So where can we go ? # request ( food ( breakfast ) ) LP : Well , no idea . RC : We 'll ask the question . LP : I have no idea where . First of all , if it 's open to outsiders . RC : I do n't know . LP : So um ... # incomplete-da ( ) RC : We 'll ask him . RC : I do n't know what your name is . Can you give us information and tell us what your name is ? # request ( ari ( name ) ) ARI : Hello , my name is ARI . # greet ( ) ; inform ( ari ( name ) ) RC : Where 's the cafeteria ? # request ( location ( cafe ) ) ARI : How can I help you ? # offer-help ( ) ARI : There are a few options available as part of your visit , and there 's also a cafeteria on the ground floor . # inform ( location ( cafe ) ) RC : On the ground floor . LP : And how do we get to the cafeteria ? # request ( directions ( cafe ) ) ARI : You have to enter the second building behind you . Then it 's the second door on the left . # inform ( directions ( cafe ) ) LP : The second building , um ... Do we take do we take the walkway ? ARI : Yes . # affirm ( ) RC : I 'd really like to know what we can eat . I want a croissant and a large white coffee . # request ( food ( croissant ) ) ; request ( beverage ( coffee ) ) ARI : Today we have an endive salad to start , followed by a ham and cheese escalope with a side of mashed potato and a fruit compote for dessert . # inform ( food ( menu ) ) LP : Yes , that 's for lunch . We would like a snack , would n't we ? Grab a coffee or breakfast , since we 're early for our appointment . # request ( food ( snack ) ) ; request ( beverage ( coffee ) ) ; request ( food ( breakfast ) ) ARI : Of course . # affirm ( ) RC : And I 'd really like to go to the toilet too . # request ( location ( toilet ) ) RC : Can you tell us where the toilets are ? # request ( location ( toilet ) ) ARI : Very easy ! You have to go to the corridor at the end of the room . It 's the second door on the right . # inform ( directions ( toilet ) ) RC : Second door on the right . Oh well , we 'll find it . LP : Next to so it 's next to the cafeteria ? # r-confirm ( location ( toilet ) ) ARI : Absolutely . # affirm ( ) RC : I feel like it 's further away . That , that 's not on the ground floor . LP : I 'm having difficulty understanding what he 's saying . I ca n't hear very well . # cant-hear ( ) ARI : Very easy ! You have to go to the corridor at the end of the room . It 's the second door on the right . # p-repet ( directions ( toilet ) ) LP : In the corridor at the end of the room , on which side ? # request ( location ( toilet ) ) RC : We 'll let it go . [start] LP : We 'll leave it , we 'll leave it . RC : We 're going to eat something already . I 'm very hungry . [MASK] RC : Do you think it 's still time ? Until what time is breakfast served ? [MASK] ARI : Yes . [MASK] ARI : Sorry , I do n't have this information . [MASK] LP : Um so , if I 've understood correctly , the toilets are next to the cafeteria . [MASK] ARI : Absolutely . [MASK] LP : I 'm having a hard time hearing actually . [MASK] RC : Could you speak a little louder ? [MASK] ARI : I 'm afraid I ca n't help you . [MASK] RC : You ca n't help us , so what are we going to do ? We 'll see something else maybe . [MASK] LP : So um ... [MASK] LP : So maybe we 'll go and have a look . Ah yes but well I think I 've forgotten my sheet . LP : I know I have an appointment but I do n't know what time it 's at . How can I find out my appointment time ? [MASK] ARI : I 'm afraid I ca n't help you . [MASK] RC : Well , firstly do you know where to find um which doctor it is , which department , which specialty . LP : Is there a reception ? [MASK] ARI : You 'll have several appointments with different health professionals , at least three . First , a nurse will ask you questions about your health and carry out an initial assessment of your current condition . Next , you will discuss your difficulties with a neuropsychologist who will suggest tests to assess your abilities as accurately as possible . Then , you will see a geriatrician who will summarise all this data and suggest different types of follow-up depending on your results . [MASK] LP : Um , how do I know what time my appointment is ? [MASK] ARI : Sorry , I do n't have this information . [MASK] LP : Um ... And ... And where is um ... Um , I , I remember , I think it 's room 17 . But I 'm not sure . Where is room 17 ? [MASK] [end] ARI : You continue along the building , take the lift and it 's on the second floor . # inform ( directions ( room_17 ) ) LP : And you arrive directly in room 17 ? # r-confirm ( directions ( room_17 ) ) ARI : Of course . # affirm ( ) RC : Maybe it 's at the reception . Maybe there 's a service , a receptionist who will let you know who will tell you . # request ( location ( reception ) ) LP : So my appointment time will be confirmed in room 17 ? # request ( appt ( place ) ) ARI : Thank you . See you around . Have a nice day . # thank ( ) ; bye ( ) RC : Thank you . # thank ( ) LP : Have a nice day . # bye ( )

src: LP : Hello ARI . # greet ( ) ARI : Hello , my name is ARI . How can I help you ? # greet ( ) ; inform ( ari ( name ) ) ; offer-help ( ) [start] LP : Ask how ... [MASK] RC : Hello . I 'd like to have a small meal , can you tell me where we should go ? [MASK] ARI : There are a few options available as part of your visit , and there 's also a cafeteria on the ground floor . [MASK] RC : Can you tell me when the cafeteria opens ? [MASK] ARI : From 11 AM to 4 PM . [MASK] RC : From 11 AM to 4 PM , is that right ? [MASK] ARI : Yes , you 're right . [MASK] RC : Thank you . [MASK] ARI : You 're welcome , I 'm here to answer your questions . [MASK] RC : Is the cafeteria wheelchair accessible ? Because my friend is in a wheelchair and he ca n't get around by himself . [MASK] ARI : Yes , absolutely . [MASK] RC : Thank you . [MASK] LP : Hmm , ARI , could you tell me how to get to the cafeteria ? [MASK] ARI : There 's a cafeteria on the ground floor , near the courtyard . [MASK] RC : ARI , could you tell me if my appointment is at 11 AM ? [MASK] ARI : Sorry , I do n't have this information . You have to go to the reception . LP : He might know how to get there . LP : Can you tell me how to get to the reception ? [MASK] ARI : The reception is just behind me . Remember to take a ticket on your right . [MASK] RC : Ah , thank you . [MASK] LP : It 's quite simple . Thank you ARI . [MASK] ARI : You 're welcome . I 'm here to answer your questions . [MASK] LP : It would be nice if we knew how to take the lift . LP : ARI , could you tell us how to get to the lift ? [MASK] [end] ARI : The lifts are at the entrance on the left . # inform ( location ( lifts ) ) LP : Do these lifts take us to the cafeteria , or do we have to take something else ? ARI : I 'm sorry , but I ca n't help you . # cant-help ( ) RC : Is the cafeteria on the ground floor ? # request ( location ( cafe ) ) ARI : Yes , you 're right . # affirm ( ) RC : So we do n't have to take the lift to get to the cafeteria ? ARI : No , you do not . # disaffirm ( ) RC : Thank you . # thank ( ) LP : Thank you very much ARI . # thank ( ) ARI : You 're welcome , thank you , see you later and have a nice day . # thank ( ) ; bye ( )

src: [start] ARI : Hello , my name is ARI . How can I help you ? [MASK] RP : Hello ARI , we have to find a lift to get to the next floor . Where is the lift in this building ? [MASK] ARI : The lifts are at the entrance on the left . [MASK] [end] RP : Ok , and we have time to have a coffee before going upstairs , is that right ? # acknowledge ( ) ; request ( beverage ( coffee ) ) ARI : Yes , absolutely . # affirm ( ) RP : Wait , so we 'll go to the cafeteria before taking the lift .
tgt: ARI : Hello , my name is ARI . How can I help you ? # greet ( ) ; inform ( ari ( name ) ) ; offer-help ( ) RP : Hello ARI , we have to find a lift to get to the next floor . Where is the lift in this building ? # greet ( ) ; request ( location ( lift ) ) ARI : The lifts are at the entrance on the left . # inform ( location ( lift ) )

src: ARI : Hello , my name is ARI . How can I help you ? # greet ( ) ; inform ( ari ( name ) ) ; offer-help ( ) [start] LP : Where can we eat ? [MASK] RC : ARI , the person that I 'm accompanying feels intimidated by by you , and and they 'd like to know where they can eat . [MASK] ARI : There 's a cafeteria on the ground floor , near the courtyard . [MASK] LP : Are there toilets ? And where are they ? [MASK] RC : I 'm asking on behalf of the person that I 'm accompanying , who is asking me , well , where are the toilets ? [MASK] ARI : Very easy ! You have to go to the corridor at the end of the room . [MASK] LP : Are they accessible by disabled people ? [MASK] RC : My ... My friend does n't walk very well , can he get into the toilets with his ... [MASK] LP : Wheelchair . RC : his wheelchair ? [MASK] ARI : Yes , absolutely . [MASK] LP : I have an appointment in room 17 , where is it ? [MASK] RC : And he 's a bit lost , he has an appointment , he 's been asked to go to , to go to room 17 . Could you tell us where to go , please ? [MASK] ARI : The examination room is on the second floor . You just have to go to the counter on the left and then a nurse will come and take care of you . The lifts are at the entrance on the left . [MASK] LP : Is it wheelchair accessible ? [MASK] RC : Is the lift wheelchair accessible ? Can he use the lift ? [MASK] [end] ARI : Yes , you 're right . # affirm ( ) LP : I have an appointment at 10 AM , how long ... ah well yes ... # incomplete-da ( ) RC : He has an appointment at 10 o'clock . Do you know if there is a waiting time , if he has time for a coffee or do we have to go straight to the treatment room ? # request ( clinic ( busyness ) ) ARI : No , there are n't too many people . The doctor will take you on time . # disaffirm ( ) ; inform ( clinic ( busyness ) ) LP : I do n't know ... # incomplete-da ( ) ARI : Thank you , see you around , have a nice day . # thank ( ) ; bye ( )

And where are they ? # request ( location ( toilet ) ) RC : I 'm asking on behalf of the person that I 'm accompanying , who is asking me , well , where are the toilets ? # request ( location ( toilet ) ) ARI : Very easy ! My friend does n't walk very well , can he get into the toilets with his ... # request ( toilet ( accessible ) ) LP : Wheelchair . RC : his wheelchair ? # request ( toilet ( accessible ) ) ARI : Yes , absolutely . # affirm ( ) LP : I have an appointment in room 17 , where is it ? # request ( location ( room_17 ) ) RC : And he 's a bit lost , he has an appointment , he 's been asked to go to , to go to room 17 . Could you tell us where to go , please ? # request ( location ( room_17 ) ) ARI : The examination room is on the second floor . You just have to go to the counter on the left and then a nurse will come and take care of you . The lifts are at the entrance on the left . # inform ( location ( room_17 ) ) LP : Is it wheelchair accessible ? # request ( is_accessible ( lift ) ) RC : Is the lift wheelchair accessible ? Can he use the lift ? # request ( is_accessible ( lift ) )

src: [start] ARI : Hello , I 'm ARI the robot . Can I help you ? [MASK] RC : Well , um , we 'd like to go to room 17 for an appointment . Where is ... Which way should we go to get to room 17 ? [MASK] ARI : The examination room is on the second floor . You just have to go to the counter on the left and then a nurse will come and take care of you . [MASK] LP : Do you think he 's going to take us to room 17 ? Because it looks like he 's stuck here . RC : Oh , I think so . Room 17 ... [MASK] LP : How could we ask him ? RC : It is room 17 that you 're showing us to ? ARI : Yes , you 're right . [MASK] RC : So everything 's fine , we can go . We have an appointment in 5 minutes , do we have time to go there ? ARI : Yes , of course . [MASK] [end] LP : Yes , my friend has forgotten his appointment time . He ca n't remember the doctor 's name either , can you help us please ? Will he ever move ? # request ( appt ( time ) ) ; request ( doctor ( name ) ) ARI : I 'm going to call a nurse to come and inform you . Do you have any other questions ? # call-nurse ( ) ; offer-help ( ) RC : We 'll wait for the nurse . ARI : Yes . # acknowledge ( ) ARI : Thank you , goodbye . # thank ( ) ; bye ( ) RC : Goodbye . # bye ( )

Because it looks like he 's stuck here . RC : Oh , I think so . Room 17 ... # affirm ( ) LP : How could we ask him ? RC : It is room 17 that you 're showing us to ? ARI : Yes , you 're right . # affirm ( ) RC : So everything 's fine , we can go . We have an appointment in 5 minutes , do we have time to go there ? ARI : Yes , of course . # affirm ( )
